title: Infosys' weak Q4 earnings have a price, brokerages slash targets by 9-13%
summary: Financial brokerages have reduced their target prices for Infosys by 9-13% following weak Q4 earnings results. This development has impacted market sentiment around one of India's leading IT services companies.
content:
Following disappointing fourth-quarter earnings results, major brokerages have significantly reduced their target prices for Infosys, with cuts ranging between 9% and 13%. The development reflects growing concerns about the company's near-term growth prospects in the technology services sector.

The news has created ripples in the Indian stock market, particularly affecting trading patterns in the technology sector. Infosys, being one of India's largest IT services exporters, has traditionally been seen as a bellwether for the industry.

The stock price adjustments come amid broader market developments and changing dynamics in the global technology services landscape.
